description: You can pay the daily Congestion Charge and the ULEZ charge for a vehicle that is not on your Fleet Auto Pay service.

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["You can pay the daily Congestion Charge and the ULEZ charge for a vehicle that is not on your Fleet Auto Pay service."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
You do not have to pay the annual registration charge for these vehicles. The Congestion Charge and/or ULEZ  charge will be added to your next monthly statement.
You are allowed a number of ad hoc charges each month. This is based on the number of vehicles you had on your Fleet Auto Pay service when your last statement was issued.
You can check when this discount expires in the 'Manage discounts' section of your account. You can still continue to pay for Congestion Charges and ULEZ charges.
Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by us today, your vehicle is  exempt from the Congestion Charge.
If you believe this information is incorrect you can still continue.
This exemption could change without notice - always check to see if you need to pay for journeys into the zone.
If the Vehicle Registration Mark is correct but the description shown is wrong, you can still pay for this vehicle.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA, so you'll need to let the DVLA know if your details are wrong or need to be updated.
UK-registered: If your vehicle’s make and model details have not been returned, please make sure you entered the Vehicle Registration Mark correctly before continuing.
Registered outside the United Kingdom: We are unable to display the make, model and colour information. Confirm your details before continuing.
This vehicle is already on an Auto Pay service and can't be added again.
If it is not on your service, please call 0343 222 2222 ( TfL call charges ) for more information.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What if my vehicle details are incorrect?"}
If the number plate is correct but the description shown is wrong, you can still continue.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA so you'll need to let the DVLA know if your details are wrong or need to be updated.
